availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Philip Maury (Bath County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, post office clerk and carpenter. Bath County, Kentucky, native. Son of Matthew Maury. Post office clerk in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 158A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 239.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994041, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 170.
"Oldest Postal Clerk to be Buried To-Day," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), September 19, 1906, p. 9.
"John Philip Maury (1830-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial 231627330, accessed March 30, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/231627330.
